data: 'What a happy dog I ought to be!' exclaimed Frank Sydney, as he reposed his slippered feet upon the fender, and sipped his third glass of old Madeira, one winter’s evening in the year 18—, in the great city of New York.
City Crimes; Or, Life in New York and Boston
